intro: Noccaea thlaspidioides, commonly known as the glaucous sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in dry conditions. Noccaea thlaspidioides is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
